headline.main: Letter: The Headache That Wouldn’t Go Away
headline.print_headline: The Headache That Wouldn’t Go Away

docs.snippet: “We were disturbed to read, in Lisa Sanders’s Diagnosis column, about the reluctance to perform CT scanning due to concerns about fetal exposure to radiation.”

docs.lead_paragraph: For the past nine months, Andre Lambertson and I have been reporting in Haiti, focusing mainly on H.I.V. and AIDS. At first glance, it seems to be a doubly depressing topic. As if the earthquake - with its death, displacement and lost limbs - were not enough, we've had to turn our attention to those who are even more vulnerable, and who, because of their disease, are often forced to live in the shadows.

headline.main: Earning the Trust of Haitians With H.I.V.

docs.abstract: They are the most vulnerable of the already vulnerable. Lisa Armstrong tells how she and the photographer Andre Lambertson won their confidence.
docs.snippet: They are the most vulnerable of the already vulnerable. Lisa Armstrong tells how she and the photographer Andre Lambertson won their confidence.

docs.lead_paragraph: At the designer Victoria Bartlett’s new boutique, wispy-clingy clothing is displayed amid medicine balls, a pommel horse and other vintage gymnasia.
